title: Mount Jefferson (Nevada)
text: Mount Jefferson is the highest <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in both the <a href="Toquima%20Range">Toquima Range</a> and <a href="Nye%20County%2C%20Nevada">Nye County</a> in <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It is the sixth highest mountain in the state. As the high point of a range which is well separated from other ranges by low basins, Mount Jefferson has a high <a href="topographic%20prominence">topographic prominence</a> of . This makes it the most prominent peak in Nye County and the third most prominent peak in Nevada (after <a href="Mount%20Charleston">Charleston Peak</a> and <a href="Wheeler%20Peak%20%28Nevada%29">Wheeler Peak</a>). For similar reasons, it is also the highest mountain for over 90 miles in all directions. It is located about northeast of the county seat of <a href="Tonopah%2C%20Nevada">Tonopah</a> within the <a href="Alta%20Toquima%20Wilderness">Alta Toquima Wilderness</a> of the <a href="Humboldt-Toiyabe%20National%20Forest">Humboldt-Toiyabe National Forest</a>, near the smaller towns of <a href="Carvers%2C%20Nevada">Carvers</a> and <a href="Round%20Mountain%2C%20Nevada">Round Mountain</a>. Three distinct summits are located on a broad area of subalpine <a href="tundra">tundra</a>: North Summit rises to , Middle Summit to , and South Summit to . During the <a href="Pleistocene">Pleistocene</a>, alpine <a href="glacier">glacier</a>s eroded several <a href="cirque">cirque</a>s east of the summit plateau.
